master.commit_message:
Makefile: allow CFLAGS to be defined in the environment

Some build systems (e.g. Fedora) put the needed build flags in the CFLAGS
environment. Support that.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

handlers: add ipip/sit/ip6tnl support

Copious amounts of copy/paste from the gre handler.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

handlers: gre: add support for erspan

Just reuse the gre handlers. erspan devices have some additional
properties that we may need to output.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

handlers: gre: add support for ip6gre and ip6gretap

No difference with gre except the family of the local/remote address.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

gre: detect link

Very similar to VXLAN's handling of IFLA_VXLAN_LOCAL: save the local
address, and try to match it to a device in the correct netns.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

vti: detect link

Very similar to VXLAN's handling of IFLA_VXLAN_LOCAL: save the local
address, and try to match it to a device in the correct netns.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

vxlan: fix link detection for cross-net devices

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

add link-netnsid for devices without a peer

Some devices, such as VXLAN tunnels, export a IFLA_LINK_NETNSID, which
is the netns in which they lookup routes for the outer IP header, but
don't have a corresponding link (IFLA_LINK). Currently, we're not
dumping that information.

This patch adds a link_net relation to each if_entry, which is set
similarly to the way peers are found. This is then printed by the
frontends only when the device doesn't have a link.

In the dot frontend, we add a dashed arrow (like for IF_LINK_WEAK
links) to the box of the peer netns, or to an unboxed "root netns"
label in the case of init_net. This label is only shown when needed,
so output_ifaces_pass1 is updated to check if we need it.

In the json frontend, links that don't already have a peer or
parent/child relationship now get a "link-netns" attribute, containing
the "id" attribute of the namespace.

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

netns: more robust handling of /var/run/netns/ files

It turns out that in some cases, there may be files left in /var/run/netns/
that are not valid netns mounts. Most likely it's a result of some software
incorrectly cleaning up or crashing between unmounting and removing a file
there.

Handle this gracefully by producing a warning to the output file rather than
terminating.

Reference: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/610466/is-there-a-tool-to-print-the-network-topology-structure-in-linux
Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

add macsec support

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

add xfrmi support

[jbenc: added compat.h code]

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

add vti support

[jbenc: added linux/if.h and linux/ip.h includes for older systems]

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>
Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

add geneve support

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

vxlan: fix port endianness

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

netlink: introduce nla_read_b{16,32,64}

Signed-off-by: Sabrina Dubroca <sd@queasysnail.net>

if: add basic XDP support

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

bond: fix potential out of bounds access

Fix off by one in bond_mode_name array access.

Fixes: ae3278386df7 ("bond: new handler")
Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

if: reorganize struct if_entry

Group fields together by logical function and add comments.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

openvswitch: output hw device for dpdk ports

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

if: support sub_driver

Currently used for 'tun' interfaces to display what is using them. Only
openvswitch supported in this commit, this may be used later for VMs etc.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

openvswitch: recognize also netdev bridge type

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

Use the right version of capget syscall

Prevents the warning in kernel log:

warning: `plotnetcfg' uses 32-bit capabilities (legacy support in use)

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

args: fix long args parsing

Maybe we should add a macro to find n-th member of a list.

Fixes: 2533dde91ef7 ("lists: args transformed")
Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netns, gre: plug leaks

[jbenc: simplified the code in gre_netlink]

Signed-off-by: Roman Kapl <code@rkapl.cz>

netns: crash when netns is not supported

The `ids` list was initialized only when ids were listed, this causing
crash on destroy. Moved to `netns_create`.

Signed-off-by: Roman Kapl <code@rkapl.cz>

openvswitch: refactoring

Added missing error paths, some errors are no longer fatal.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

openvswitch: add key to tunnels

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

openvswitch: use vxlan functionality also for gre and geneve

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

openvswitch: refactored parsing options

Reduces code duplication and simplifies extending at the cost of
multiple traversal of small array.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

gre: fix keys byte order

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

gre: do not output zero addresses and keys

Netlink reports addresses and keys are set even when they are zero and
unused. It only clutters the output, so let's avoid it.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

Makefile: fix static build

The jansson include path was broken. It worked only if we had jansson
installed in /usr/include too.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

fix: do not segfault when peer not found

Calling with NULL arguments may happen. For instance, when plotnetcfg is
run in a container, netns_get_all_ids fails silently and
match_all_netnsid then have no chance to find peers, though netnsids are
known. In this case, this commit changes behavior from segfault to
"failed to find the veth peer".

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

netlink: timeout and retry exchange

When the response is lost, nl_recv would block forever. This commit adds
timeout before recvmsg, which results in repeating the whole exchange.
It uses the same retry counter as the interrupted dump retry mechanism.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

typo: perr -> peer

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

gre: implemented basic handler

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

route: fix freeing uninitialized pointer

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

dot: output newline indirectly

Dot interprets "\n" by itself. Although outputting the newline chracter in
the middle of the string works, too, this generates nicer dot files.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: do not alloc unnecessary attribute tables

Walk through attributes instead of allocating attribute table when it makes
better sense.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: macros to iterate over attributes

Introduce for_each_nla and for_each_nla_nested macros.

Use them to simplify the functions that create attribute tables. This also
gets rid of the temporary hacks.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: message buffer based API

Introduce struct nlmsg which is a message buffer. It allows data and
attributes to be pushed to the buffer tail (put) and popped off the buffer
head (get) and resizes itself automatically as needed.

To access the message header regardless of the current head position,
nlmsg_get_hdr macro is available.

nla_attrs is converted to nlmsg_attrs and accepts the message buffer.

Two functions that ease creating of rtnetlink and genetlink message are
provided. A helper function for rtnetlink ifinfo dump is provided, too; it
should be replaced by a more generic rtnl dump function in the future, if
possible.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: open code nla_nested_attrs

In the next commit, nla_attrs will be changed into nlmsg_attrs. Decouple
nla_nested_attrs from nla_attrs, as it won't be able to call it anymore.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

nelink: export nl_open

It's not used outside of netlink.c but let's have consistent API, we'll
soon have enough functionality to handle any netlink protocol.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: allocate attr tables dynamically

This is safer as the array has always the right size; it's not neccessary to
keep the array size and max parameter to nla_parse in sync.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: replace rtattr with nlattr

struct nlattr represents a netlink attribute indepent on family;
struct rtattr is a rtnetlink attribute. It's weird to use rtattr for other
families, such as genetlink. At the same time, nlattr and rtattr are the
same structs on common architectures.

Just use struct nlattr everywhere. Convert the access macros to inline
functions for better type control. They also got renamed from "get" to
"read", as in the following patches "put" and "get" are operations that
manipulate the current buffer offset which is not happening here.

The nla_parse function (former rtnl_parse) continues to use RTA_OK and
RTA_NEXT macros with ugly typecasting. This will be changed in the following
patches. The nla_parse_nested function discards the const qualifier from the
nla_read() result; again, this will be fixed by next patches.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: nl_check_interrupted_dump and nl_send should be static

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

netlink: remove extraneous newline

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

addr: pass netlink attribute to mac_addr_fill_netlink

It's more comprehensible to pass the netlink attribute instead of a raw
buffer.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

addr: constify argument to addr_init

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

vlan: remove excessive verification

We don't check attributes this rigorously anywhere else. Should we decide to
want this, the proper place is the attribute value accessor
macros/functions.

Remove the check for u16 attribute size.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

if: better cleanup on error in if_list

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

if: fix missing whitespace

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

openvswitch: fix possible memory leaks

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

cleanup: switch calloc arguments to correct order

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

struct if_entry must be initialized

Fixes segfaults when ovs handler creates if_entry themselves.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

openvswitch: fix segfault with OVS configured

As an error from the lists reform, struct ovs_if was typecasted to
if_entry, which resulted to segfault later on.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: openvswitch handler transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: labels transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: handlers transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: netns transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

match: changed API

The old match API exploited the structure of list, reusing one argument
for both a list of namespaces and a single namespace. With the list
reform, this is not possible. Using function arguments would result
either in hard-to-use functions with many NULL parameters, or code
duplication.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: routes transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: interfaces transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: frontend transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: args transformed

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: implementation

Generic (and common) implementation of doubly-linked lists to make
working with them more comfortable and uniform.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

lists: prepare commit

Renames list_free to slist_free in order to make room for list_free
function on lists. This method will be removed after the transformation.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handler: fix wrong handler type

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

typo: preferred was spelled wrong

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

netlink: free memory on error

When doing dumps, *dest may be already allocated. Free it correctly on
errors.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

json: output routes

Update the json frontend to output also routing information.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

route: new handler

This handler fills the routing tables inside netns structures, using
netlink.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

route: new module

This module contains internal structures to maintain information about
routing, and some classifying methods for frontends. They can be used
to print user-readable names of constants instead of the numerals.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: global init handler error handling

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: netns handlers

Introduces new handler type, which is called on all network namespaces
found.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: common handler infrastructure

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: plain handlers are now if_handlers

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: remove unused generic cleanup

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: rename ovs to openvswitch

So that all handler_*_register function names match the file names.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

netlink: helper functions for nl attributes

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

json: output helper for address family

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

addr: helper max_prefix_len

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

addr: enable formatting without netmask

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

build with c99 standard

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

fix bug in mac address formatting

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

cleanup: reorganized includes

From now, includes follow a convention:
1) own header file
2) system header files
3) project header files

In every category, sorted lexicographically. This should prevent include
loops and ensure every header file can be included on its own, making
adding new functionality easier.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

netlink: retry interrupted dump

When two netlink dumps are called concurrently, the dump can be
interrupted. This is indicated by nlmsg flag NLM_F_DUMP_INTR in one of
the headers, and the dump can be inconsistent.

Whenever this occurs, restart the dump. Limit the number of restarts.

Inconsistency can still happen when interfaces change in between dump
calls. This is not yet covered.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

MAC addresses

Now we are showing MAC addresses of non-loopback interfaces. In JSON,
you can find it in interface object, field 'mac'.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

if: more robust driver detection

Some drivers (e.g. sit) do not implement ethtool ops. Do not terminate when
encountering such interfaces but try to fallback to rtnl driver. If even
that is not present, continue with an "unknown" driver.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

handlers: pass linkinfo to the netlink handler

All current handlers need to extract IFLA_LINKINFO and it's the only thing
they care about. Save them some work. We'll need the linkinfo parsed in
fill_if_link itself later.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

fix: typo in include guard

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

frontends: enable printing configuration only

By using --config-only switch, you can now print just configuration of
interfaces. Useful for automated testing.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

split configuration and state

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

json: associative arrays

Instead of plain old arrays, interfaces and namespaces are output as
associative arrays, sorted by their keys. That makes output more stable
between runs.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

Fix compilation on RHEL6

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

frontend: simplified error message

No need to be too elaborate, the meaning is clear.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

multiple output specification

Now you can send output from plotnetcfg in a file and specify multiple
output formats.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

cleanup: lexicographical sorting

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handlers: managing handler_private

Instead of allocating handler_private in first used handler and freeing
it in cleanup, fill private_size and let handler code do that for you.

Also, restructure netlink error path to not ignore errors from handlers.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

vxlan: New handler

Supports vxlan detection, reads local and group (unicast remote)
addresses, port and vxlan id. Also tries to detect outgoing link.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

tunnel: more generic searching

Use struct addr instead of similar internal structure, which enables
searching for struct addr's directly.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

peer is an undirected relation

Previously, if_entry->peer was used with flag IF_PEER_WEAK as one-way
peer. This relation is more a "link" than peer. Let's use link for these
purposes.

IF_WEAK_LINK means, that this is not the link kernel reports, but
something we made up from information we have.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

addr: split away address handling

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

team: new handler

Similar to bond, plotnetcfg can now connect to running teamd and get
runner name and active port from it.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

correct handling of reverse links

Link is an 1:N relation, so if_entry->rev_link must be a list.

Json format increased to 2, as interface property "parent" was replaced
by "parents" array containing all ifaces, which have this one as link
(or just one master).

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

match: cleanup

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

bond: new handler

Bonding handler currently supports reading mode and active slave.

When appropriate, non-active slaves have flag IF_PASSIVE_SLAVE and are
denoted by dashed arrow in dot output.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

master: resolve rev_master on the fly

Some handlers will need rev_master populated, so instead of building
list after all work, keep them updated.

Use master_set instead of assigning to if_entry->master.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

sysfs: utility function to read a file

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

Makefile: fix wrong argument

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

Compatibility with current libjansson

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

Make dependencies are now generated

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

iov: new module

iov detects relations between virtual and physical functions.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

match: simple matching

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

sysfs: introduced

Makes resolving links in sysfs really simple.

Signed-off-by: Ondrej Hlavaty <ohlavaty@redhat.com>

handler: fix unitialized variable

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

openvswitch: move err initialization

Initialize the error code at the beginning of the function to prevent
further mistakes.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

openvswitch: kill a 'sometimes-initialized' error field

It's possible that if the nla_add_str fails, the result from
exiting the function will be invalid. Set it to ENOMEM (which
is the cause when length is 0), and then cleanup errors.

Signed-off-by: Aaron Conole <aconole@redhat.com>

Makefile: Support multiple C compilers (for possible cross compilation)

Additionally, this allows using either gcc or clang to build the final
plotnetcfg binary. And since building for ARM may require extra cflags,
allow commandline to append additional cflags.

Signed-off-by: Aaron Conole <aconole@bytheb.org>

netns: fix check for non-process dirs in /proc

The check happened to work okay even with the typo because there are no
strangely named directories in /proc.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>

Update README

There's also json frontend now.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Benc <jbenc@redhat.com>
